intro: Spermacoce amapaensis, commonly known as the Amapa sida, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Spermacoce amapaensis is often found growing in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to the humid tropical climate of its native habitat.
